question: Which institution hosted the National Youth Conclave 2024?
solution:
• TheNational Youth Conclave 2024washosted by IIT Bhilai.
  • The event took place atVigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.
  • The conclave aims tofoster collaboration between the country's youth and government leadership.
  • It serves as a platform foryouth engagement, policy discussions, and promoting innovation and leadership.

question: DEF EXPO 2024 is the ___ edition and held in which location?
solution:
• DEF EXPO 2024 is the14th editionof the biennial defence exhibition in India.
  • It is held inAhmedabad, Gujarat.
  • The expo showcasesdemonstrations by armed forcesto boost Indian startups and encourage investments in the defence sector.
  • It provides a platform for interaction between the Indian defence industry, international exhibitors, and stakeholders.
  • DEF EXPO promotesMake in Indiainitiatives and advances India’s defence manufacturing capabilities.

question: Khadi Utsav 2025 will be held in which city?
solution:
• Khadi Utsav 2025 is scheduled to be held inPrayagraj, Uttar Pradesh.
  • The event will highlight the theme ofAtmanirbhar Bharat (Self-Reliant India).
  • Focus areas includeKhadi for Nation, Khadi for Fashion, and Khadi for Transformation.
  • The event was hosted during the Mahakumbh Mela period in Prayagraj, showcasing Khadi products and promoting local artisans.
  • It serves to emphasize India’s commitment to sustainable local industries, self-reliance, and preserving traditional crafts.

question: Where will the second edition of the Regional Official Language conference 2025 be held?
solution:
• Thesecond edition of the Regional Official Language conference 2025will be held inJaipur.
  • The conference aims toensure effective implementation of the Official Language Policyacross Central Government Offices, Banks, PSUs, Autonomous Bodies, and Town Official Language Implementation Committees in these regions.
  • Thefirst edition was held on 4th January 2025 in Mysore, Karnataka.
  • The conference serves as a platform for discussing challenges and best practices related to the official language usage in government and affiliated institutions.
  • It contributes to promoting regional languages and the constitutional mandate for the use of Hindi and other official languages.

question: Which edition of the Akhil Bharatiya Rajbhasha Sammelan is being held in 2024?
solution:
• The4th edition of Akhil Bharatiya Rajbhasha Sammelanis scheduled to be held in2024.
  • The event will take place atBharat Mandapam, New Delhi.
  • It commemorates thecompletion of 75 years of Hindi becoming the official languageof India.
  • The Department of Official Language, Ministry of Home Affairs, organizes this conference to promote Hindi and discuss its progress as an official language.
  • The Sammelan also includes launch of special Diamond Jubilee commemorations like postage stamps, coins, and awards.
  • The event convenes language experts, government officials, and scholars to discuss the promotion and development of Hindi.

question: Southern Zonal Council meeting 31st edition is chaired by whom?
solution:
• The31st Southern Zonal Council meetingheld inChennai, Tamil Nadu, waschaired by Union Home Minister Amit Shah.
  • The meeting included representatives fromsouthern statessuch asTamil Nadu, Kerala, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and theUnion Territory of Puducherry.
  • It addressed a wide range of issues includingboundary disputes, security, infrastructure, environment, education, and disaster relief.
  • TheSouthern Zonal Councilis one of five zonal councils established under theStates Reorganisation Act, 1956to promotecooperative federalismand resolveinter-state matters.
  • Thechairmanship traditionally rests with the Union Home Minister, while thehost state Chief Minister acts as vice-chairman.

question: What was the venue of the India Clean Air Summit 2024?
option_2: India Habitat Centre, New Delhi
option_3: Sheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway, Bengaluru
option_4: ITC Grand Chola, Chennai
solution:
• TheIndia Clean Air Summit 2024is the6th editionof the event focused on addressing air pollution and climate change.
  • It isjointly organized by CSTEP (Center for Study of Science, Technology and Policy) and Clean Air Monitoring & Solutions Network (CAMS-Net).
  • The venue for ICAS 2024 isSheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway, Bengaluru.
  • The summit runs from26th to 30th August 2024and involves scientists, policymakers, researchers, and manufacturers discussing air quality management.
  • Themes includeparticipatory approaches to air quality management, source apportionment, climate action alignment, and low-cost sensor technology.
  • The event promotes collaborative efforts toward cleaner air and healthier environments in India.

question: Who inaugurated India’s first Animal Health Summit held in New Delhi in which year?
solution:
• India’s firstAnimal Health Summitwas held inNew Delhi in July 2022.
  • The summit was organized by theIndian Chamber of Food and Agriculture (ICFA)and theAgriculture Today Group.
  • It wasinaugurated by Parshottam Rupala, the Union Minister of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, on6th July 2022.
  • The event focused on thesignificance of animal healthtowards food security, rural incomes, and overall economic development.
  • It provided a platform for discussinganimal health policy, business environment, and investment opportunitiesin the sector.

question: What is the focus of the 2nd Industrial Decarbonization Summit 2025?
option_1: Road map for carbon neutrality by 2070
option_2: Promotion of electric vehicles
option_3: Subsidies for fossil fuel industries
option_4: Expansion of coal power plants
solution:
• The2nd Industrial Decarbonization Summit 2025was held inNew Delhion15th January 2025at Hotel Le Meridien.
  • The summit wasinaugurated by Union Minister Nitin Gadkari.
  • Its key focus was the"Road to Net Zero", specifically aroad map for achieving carbon neutrality by 2070, aligned with India's climate commitments.
  • The event brought together policymakers, industry experts, researchers, and regulatory bodies to discussdecarbonization technologies, climate change management, and sustainabilitymeasures.
  • It aimed to inspire action and promote innovative solutions for reducing industrial carbon emissions and transitioning to clean energy.
  • The summit reinforced India’s commitment to sustainable development while maintaining industrial growth.

question: Who inaugurated the Semicon India Conference 2024?
solution:
• TheSemicon India Conference 2024wasinaugurated by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi.
  • The event was held atIndia Expo Mart, Greater Noida, Uttar Pradeshfrom 11th to 13th September 2024.
  • The conference aimed toestablish India as a key partner in the global semiconductor supply chain.
  • It showcased India’ssemiconductor strategy and policiesto make India a global semiconductor hub.
  • More than250 exhibitors and 150 speakersfrom the semiconductor ecosystem participated.
  • PM Modi emphasized India’s growing semiconductor workforce and the importance of stable policies and ease of doing business.

question: What is the theme of Wings India 2024?
option_3: Linking India to the World
option_4: Linking India to the World with Focus on Trade Investment and Regional Connectivity
solution:
• Wings India 2024 is held at itspermanent venue in Hyderabad, Telangana.
  • The theme is"Linking India to the World" with a focus on trade investment and regional connectivity.
  • The event aims to promotecollaboration between global and Indian aviation sectors, encouraging trade and investment opportunities.
  • It highlights the importance of strengtheningregional connectivity in Indiato boost economic growth.
  • Wings India serves asAsia’s largest civil aviation eventbringing together stakeholders, policymakers, and businesses.
  • The event also facilitates innovation, partnerships, and opportunities in aviation aligned with India's global aspirations.

question: Where was the Tech Conclave 2025 held?
solution:
• TheTech Conclave 2025 was held in Bengaluru.
  • Bengaluru is known as thetechnology and innovation hub of India, making it an ideal venue for promoting the use of technology in governance.
  • The conclave gathered policymakers, technology experts, and government officials to discuss tech-driven governance solutions.
  • It emphasized the role of digital tools in improving transparency, efficiency, and citizen engagement in government services.

question: Which were the theme states of the Surajkund International Crafts Fair 2025?
option_2: Odisha and Madhya Pradesh
option_4: Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh
solution:
• The38th editionof the Surajkund International Crafts Fair was held inFaridabad, Haryanain 2025.
  • For the first time, the fair featuredtwo theme states: Odisha and Madhya Pradesh.
  • These states showcased theirrich cultural heritage, traditional crafts, and folk artat the fair.
  • The dual theme states aimed to elevate the fair's status as a “Crafts Maha Kumbh” celebrating India's diverse artistic traditions.
  • The fair was inaugurated by thePresident of India, Draupadi Murmu.

question: What is the key focus of the 4th Green Hydrogen Summit 2025 held in Dwarka, New Delhi?
option_1: To establish a comprehensive Green Hydrogen ecosystem to drive global decarbonization efforts
option_2: To promote electric vehicles
option_3: To expand coal power plants
option_4: To provide subsidies for fossil fuel industries
solution:
• The4th Green Hydrogen Summit 2025is held inDwarka, New Delhi.
  • The2024 venue was ADNEC Centre, Abu Dhabi.
  • The summit aimsto establish a comprehensive Green Hydrogen ecosystem to drive global decarbonization efforts.
  • It serves as a platform for policymakers, industry experts, and stakeholders to accelerate innovations in green hydrogen production, infrastructure, and utilization.
  • The event supports global climate goals by focusing on clean energy transition and sustainable fuel development.

question: What is the venue of the 20th G-20 Summit 2025?
option_2: Cape Town, South Africa
solution:
• The20th G-20 Summit 2025is scheduled to be held inJohannesburg, South Africa.
  • This will be the first G20 summit held in Johannesburg and the African continent.
  • The theme for the summit is"Solidarity, Equality, Sustainability".
  • The summit aims to address global challenges and promote inclusive economic growth, equality, and sustainable development.
  • Preparations include significant city infrastructure and social transformation efforts.

question: Where was the 7th edition of the ISA (International Solar Alliance) Assembly 2024 held?
solution:
• The 7th edition of the ISA Assembly in 2024 took place at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi.
  • It was chaired by Pralhad Joshi, India’s Minister of New and Renewable Energy.
  • Co-chaired by Thierry Mathou, France’s Ambassador to India.
  • India was re-elected as the President of ISA, highlighting its leadership role in solar energy.
  • The conference focused on new technologies for a clean energy transition, emphasizing innovation and sustainability.
  • The International Solar Alliance (ISA) was launched on November 30, 2015, at COP21, Paris, by India and France.
  • It is atreaty-based intergovernmental organizationheadquartered in Gurugram, India.
  • Initially, ISA membership was limited to122 sun-belt countrieslying between the Tropic of Cancer and Tropic of Capricorn; later expanded to includeall UN member states.
  • Currently, ISA hasabout 120 member countries, making it one of the largest coalitions after the UN.
  • Themotiveof ISA is topromote solar energy adoption worldwide and accelerate the clean energy transition, aiming to mobilizeUSD 1 trillion in solar investments by 2030.
  • Its vision is: "Let us together make the sun brighter," and its mission includes ensuring "Every home, no matter how far away, will have a light at home."

question: Where was the 17th BRICS Summit 2025 held?
option_3: Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
solution:
• The 17th BRICS Summit was held inRio de Janeiro, Brazil on July 6-7, 2025.
  • Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva served as the BRICS president for 2025, hosting the summit.
  • Key agenda items included cooperation in global health, trade, investment and development financing, climate change response, AI governance, reform of the global security system, and institutional development of BRICS.
  • The summit focused on promoting amore inclusive global governance systemthat reflects the interests of the Global South countries.
  • India hosted theBRICS Youth Entrepreneurship Meeting in March 2025and will assume BRICS chairmanship in 2026.
  • BRICS as a bloc represents more than half of the world’s population and a significant share of global GDP and resources.

question: What is the target year to reduce carbon emissions by 43% discussed at the World Sustainable Development Summit 2025?
solution:
• The World Sustainable Development Summit (WSDS) 2025 held in New Delhi focused on reducing carbon emissions by43% by the year 2030.
  • Discussions emphasized addressing gaps in achieving Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and accelerating climate solutions.
  • India showcased itsAct4Earth initiative, which promotes green public procurement and climate finance solutions.
  • The summit highlighted that current national commitments need significant strengthening to meet the 2030 emission reduction target.
  • WSDS 2025 took place fromMarch 5 to 7, 2025and aimed to foster global partnerships for sustainable development and climate action.

question: Where was the International Yoga Festival 2025 held?
option_4: Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Rishikesh
solution:
• TheInternational Yoga Festival 2025 was held at Parmarth Niketan Ashram, Rishikesh, Uttarakhand.
  • Parmarth Niketan is the largest ashram located on the holy banks of the Ganges in the Himalayan foothills.
  • The festival brought together yoga masters, spiritual teachers, and practitioners worldwide.
  • It featured yoga classes, spiritual talks, cultural programs, and wellness therapies.
  • This venue is considered the Yoga capital of the world and a spiritual hub for yoga enthusiasts.

question: The 9th edition of the Commonwealth Law Conference 2025 will be held in which country?
solution:
• The Commonwealth Law Conference 2025 is the 9th edition of this prestigious legal gathering.
  • It will be hosted in Malta, known for its rich legal heritage and active role in international law.
  • The event will cover key topics such as human rights, the rule of law, corporate and commercial law, the judiciary, and contemporary legal issues, making it highly relevant for law professionals across the Commonwealth.
  • The choice of venue reflects Malta’s growing influence in global legal discourse.

question: The 35th edition of the NATO Summit 2025 will be hosted in which city?
solution:
• The NATO Summit 2025 is the 35th edition of the annual gathering of member countries.
  • It will be hosted in The Hague, Netherlands, an important diplomatic hub.
  • This is the first summit led by Mark Rutte, the newly appointed NATO Secretary General and former Prime Minister of the Netherlands.
  • A central discussion point will be increased defense spending, with the United States urging NATO members to allocate at least 5% of their GDP towards defense.
  • NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) is a military alliance established in 1949, comprising 31 member countries committed to mutual defense and promoting democratic values.
  • Its headquarters is located in Brussels, Belgium, and it plays a pivotal role in international security, crisis management, and cooperative defense missions across the globe.

question: The 51st edition of the G-7 Summit 2025 was held in which location?
solution:
• The G-7 Summit 2025 was the 51st edition of the annual meeting of major advanced economies.
  • It took place in Kananaskis, Alberta, Canada, a region known for hosting high-level international events.
  • Key topics discussed included international peace, economic stability, digital transition, and climate action.
  • The G-7 (Group of Seven) comprises Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the UK, and the US, with the EU also participating in a non-enumerated capacity.

question: Which edition of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference will be held in Barbados in 2025?
solution:
• The Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference 2025 will mark the 68th edition of this significant event.
  • It is scheduled to be held in Barbados, located in the Caribbean Sea, from 6th to 12th October 2025.
  • The conference will bring together parliamentarians from across the Commonwealth to discuss key legislative and governance issues.
  • Indian delegates will actively participate in discussions on judicial reforms, digital governance, and sustainable development, reflecting India's commitment to global collaboration on these critical topics.

question: Which edition of Aero India was held in Bengaluru in 2025?
solution:
• Aero India 2025 marked the 15th edition of Asia's biggest air show.
  • It was held in Bengaluru, a city renowned for its aerospace and defense industries.
  • The event reinforced India's position as a global aerospace hub, showcasing cutting-edge military aviation and defense technologies.
  • The next edition of Aero India is scheduled for 2027.

question: Where was the ASEAN Summit 2025 held?
solution:
• The ASEAN Summit 2025 hosted its 46th and 47th editions in Malaysia.
  • Leaders from ASEAN nations gathered to discuss key issues, including the adoption of the ASEAN Community Vision 2045, a 20-year roadmap for deeper integration and cooperation.
  • The next summit is scheduled for 2026 in the Philippines.
  • About ASEAN:
  • The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) was established on 8 August 1967 in Bangkok, Thailand.
  • It comprises 10 member states: Brunei, Cambodia, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia, Myanmar, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam.
  • ASEAN aims to promote economic growth, social progress, cultural development, and regional peace and stability.
  • The organization also fosters collaboration in areas such as trade, education, environment, and security.

question: Where was the Indian Ocean Conference 2025 held?
solution:
• The Indian Ocean Conference 2025 was held in Muscat, Oman, marking its 8th edition.
  • The theme of the conference was "Voyage to New Horizons of Maritime Partnership", emphasizing the importance of collaboration in maritime affairs.
  • The conference highlighted the Indian Ocean's critical role in global trade, with 80% of maritime oil transport passing through the region annually.
  • Discussions focused on maritime infrastructure, regional cooperation, and climate resilience to strengthen economic and security frameworks.

question: Which edition of the Arab League Summit was held in 2025?
solution:
• The Arab League Summit 2025 marked its 34th edition and was held in Baghdad.
  • The summit focused on critical issues such as rebuilding Gaza, rejecting displacement, and calling for a ceasefire amidst ongoing regional challenges.
  • About the Arab League Summit:
  • The Arab League was established in 1945 and consists of 22 member states from the Arab world.
  • The summit serves as a platform for discussing political, economic, and social issues affecting the region.
  • Key areas of focus include regional security, economic cooperation, and humanitarian efforts.
  • While India is not a member of the Arab League, it has historically maintained strong ties with Arab nations, particularly in trade, energy, and strategic partnerships.

question: Where was the SCO Summit 2025 held?
solution:
• The SCO Summit 2025 was held in Tianjin, China, marking its 25th edition.
  • The summit focused on key issues such as regional security, economic cooperation, and global governance.
  • India’s Representation:
    • India was represented by its External Affairs Minister, S. Jaishankar, who emphasized regional stability, trade, and digital infrastructure during the discussions.
  • About the SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organization):
  • The SCO was established in 2001 and currently includes 8 member states: China, India, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Pakistan, Russia, Tajikistan, and Uzbekistan.
  • It aims to promote regional security, economic collaboration, and cultural exchange among its members.

question: Where was the Defence Expo 2025 held?
solution:
• The Defence Expo 2025 was held in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, marking its 15th edition.
  • It is India's premier aerospace and defense manufacturing exhibition, showcasing the latest advancements in defense technology.
  • The event brought together global defense companies, policymakers, and industry leaders to discuss and promote collaboration in the defense sector.
  • The expo serves as a platform for strengthening India's defense capabilities and fostering international partnerships in the field of defense and aerospace.

question: In which country was the 30th edition of the Climate Change Conference (COP-30) held in 2025?
solution:
• The Conference of the Parties (COP) is the supreme decision-making body under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC).
  • It brings together 197 member countries annually to assess progress and negotiate climate action.
  • The 30th edition (COP-30) was held in Belém, Brazil from 10–21 November 2025.
  • Belém was selected for its proximity to the Amazon rainforest, highlighting the urgency of environmental protection.
  • Key themes included multilateralism, climate finance, biodiversity conservation, and implementation of the Paris Agreement.
  • A controversial highway project through the Amazon raised concerns, though Brazilian officials denied direct links to COP-30.
  • COP-30 served as a platform for global climate negotiations, updated national commitments, and strengthened international cooperation.

question: In which city was the Global Summit on AI Safety 2025 held, where a Joint Declaration on Inclusive and Sustainable AI was signed?
solution:
• The Global Summit on AI Safety 2025 was held in Paris, France.
  • Leaders from 58 countries, including India, China, and the European Union, participated.
  • A Joint Declaration was signed promoting Inclusive and Sustainable AI development.
  • India co-chaired the summit, strongly advocating for AI democratization, equitable data access, and innovation for all nations.
  • This summit aimed to address global concerns around AI governance, safety, and ethical usage.
  • It reinforced the role of international cooperation in shaping responsible AI futures.

question: In which city was the 13th edition of the Bio Energy Summit 2025 held, focusing on advanced biofuels and global energy transition?
solution:
• The Bio Energy Summit 2025 was the 13th edition, held in New Delhi, India.
  • The summit focused on advanced biofuels, highlighting their advantages over first-generation biofuels, such as higher efficiency, sustainability, and lower emissions.
  • Key discussions included the role of biomass in achieving net-zero targets, sustainable sourcing, and carbon capture technologies.
  • It emphasized the importance of bioenergy in the global energy transition, supporting climate goals and energy security.
  • The summit brought together global leaders, researchers, and industry experts to promote innovation in clean energy solutions.

question: In which city was the 78th edition of the World Health Assembly held in 2025, where India advocated for global health initiatives?
solution:
• The World Health Assembly (WHA) is the decision-making body of the World Health Organization (WHO), held annually to discuss global health priorities.
  • The 78th edition of WHA was held in Geneva, Switzerland in 2025.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the summit virtually, emphasizing India's global health leadership.
  • India highlighted programs such as Ayushman Bharat, digital health advancements, and pandemic preparedness initiatives.
  • India also advocated for equitable access to healthcare and promoted the International Day of Yoga, with the theme "Yoga for One Earth, One Health".
  • The summit brought nations together to discuss health equity, resilience, and collaborative strategies.

question: In which city was the 55th edition of the International Film Festival of India held in 2024, celebrating young filmmakers and global cinema?
solution:
• The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) is one of Asia’s oldest and most prominent film festivals, organized by the Government of India.
  • The 55th edition of IFFI was held in 2024 at its permanent venue – Goa, India.
  • The theme was "Young Filmmakers – the Future is Now", highlighting the creativity and potential of emerging directors.
  • The festival featured over 180 films from 81 countries, showcasing a rich diversity of global cinema.
  • It included 15 world premieres, reflecting international interest and collaboration in the Indian film scene.
  • IFFI serves as a global platform for filmmakers, fostering artistic exchange, innovation, and cultural celebration.

question: The 4th and final Sherpa Meeting of India’s G20 Presidency was held in which city in 2024?
solution:
• The Sherpa Meetings under India’s G20 Presidency 2024 played a key role in shaping the agenda and outcomes for the G20 Summit.
  • The 4th and final edition of this strategic dialogue was held in Manesar, Haryana, just ahead of the G20 Leaders’ Summit in New Delhi.
  • It was chaired by Amitabh Kant, India’s G20 Sherpa, who spearheaded crucial discussions and consensus-building among member nations.
  • The focus was on finalizing the text of the New Delhi Leaders’ Declaration, the central document of the G20 Summit.
  • Manesar was chosen for its proximity to Delhi and its capacity to host high-level international engagements.

question: The Quad Summit 2024 was held in which country?
solution:
• The Quad Summit 2024 was hosted by India, reaffirming its strategic leadership in the Indo-Pacific region.
  • The Quadrilateral Security Dialogue (Quad) is a diplomatic partnership among India, the United States, Japan, and Australia, aimed at promoting a free, open, and inclusive Indo-Pacific.
  • Originally formed in response to the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami, the Quad was formalized in 2007, revived in 2017, and has since evolved into a platform for cooperation on security, technology, climate, health, and infrastructure.
  • At the 2024 summit, leaders emphasized:
    • Indo-Pacific security and maritime domain awareness through initiatives like IPMDA and MAITRI.
    • Economic resilience, including semiconductor supply chain cooperation and digital public infrastructure principles.
    • Technological collaboration, such as Open RAN deployment, AI-ENGAGE for agriculture, and BioExplore for ecosystem research.
    • Disaster response via the Indo-Pacific Logistics Network and Quad-at-Sea Ship Observer Mission planned for 2025.
    • Health initiatives, including the Quad Cancer Moonshot targeting cervical cancer and pandemic preparedness programs.
  • PM Narendra Modi highlighted India’s role in driving digital innovation, disaster resilience, and regional stability, reinforcing its position as a key Quad pillar.
  • The summit concluded with the Quad Wilmington Declaration, outlining shared goals for sustainable development, cybersecurity, and counter-terrorism cooperation.

question: The 6th BIMSTEC Summit 2025, themed “Prosperous, Resilient, and Open BIMSTEC,” was hosted by which country, marking a milestone in regional cooperation across South and Southeast Asia?
solution:
• The Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) is a regional organization comprising seven member countries: Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Nepal, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, and Thailand.
  • The 6th BIMSTEC Summit was held on April 4, 2025, in Bangkok, Thailand, under Thailand’s chairmanship.
  • The summit adopted the Bangkok Vision 2030, a strategic roadmap for building a Prosperous, Resilient, and Open (PRO) BIMSTEC by 2030.
  • Key outcomes included:
    • Signing of the Maritime Transport Cooperation Agreement to boost regional connectivity.
    • MoUs with IORA and UNODC to expand developmental partnerships.
    • Launch of BIMSTEC Centres of Excellence in India for disaster management, traditional medicine, and agriculture.
    • India’s proposal to link UPI with BIMSTEC payment systems and operationalize the BIMSTEC Energy Centre in Bengaluru.
    • Introduction of the BODHI Program for human resource development and skill-building across member states.
  • BIMSTEC continues to serve as a strategic bridge between South Asia and Southeast Asia, promoting cooperation in security, trade, connectivity, climate resilience, and people-to-people ties.

question: The 12th World Government Summit 2025, themed “Shaping Future Governments,” was held in which city?
solution:
The World Government Summit (WGS) is a global platform launched in 2013 by Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President and Prime Minister of the UAE, to shape the future of governments through innovation and collaboration.
  • The 12th edition of the summit was held from February 11–13, 2025, in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, under the theme “Shaping Future Governments.”
  • It featured over 200 sessions, 30+ ministerial roundtables, and participation from 700+ global leaders, including heads of state, ministers, CEOs, and experts.
  • Key thematic areas included:
    • Effective Governance & Accountability
    • Climate Resilience & Sustainable Cities
    • Global Health Transformations
    • Emerging Frontiers like AI, quantum computing, and biotechnology
    • Human-Centric Futures & Capacity Building
    • Financing the Future & Global Economy
  • India’s participation was led by Union Minister Bhupender Yadav, who emphasized India’s commitment to green growth, electric mobility, and climate-resilient infrastructure.
  • India also showcased initiatives like PM E-DRIVE, National Green Hydrogen Mission, and UPI-linked digital infrastructure.
  • Indian students from MAIT, New Delhi, won the Bronze Award at the Global Best M-Gov Award 2025 for their AI-powered accessibility app “AccessWay.”
  • The summit concluded with the WGS Wilmington Declaration, outlining global cooperation goals for innovation, sustainability, and inclusive governance.

question: The GRIDCON 2025 international conference and exhibition was held in which city from March 9–11, 2025?
solution:
• GRIDCON 2025 was hosted at Yashobhoomi, India International Convention Centre, Dwarka, New Delhi.
  • Organized by POWERGRID under the Ministry of Power, in association with CIGRE India.
  • Theme: “Innovations in Grid Resilience”, focusing on renewable integration, smart asset management, and digital transformation.
  • Attended by 2000+ delegates, 150+ exhibitors, and 30+ country representatives, including top energy companies and startups.
  • Key sessions included AI-based grid monitoring, green hydrogen solutions, and the Women in Energy forum.
  • Inaugurated by Union Minister Shri Manohar Lal, with participation from senior officials and global experts.

question: The 69th session of the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women(UNCSW) in 2025 was held in which city?
solution:
• The UNCSW 2025 (CSW69) was held from 10–21 March 2025 at the United Nations Headquarters, New York.
  • It commemorated 30 years of the Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action (1995), a landmark framework for gender equality.
  • The summit focused on reviewing progress, identifying challenges, and accelerating efforts toward SDG 5 – Gender Equality.
  • Delegates from UN Member States, NGOs, and civil society participated in over 200 sessions, covering themes like women’s leadership, climate resilience, digital inclusion, and gender-based violence.
  • India emphasized its initiatives in women-led development, financial inclusion, and gender-responsive governance.
